title: 114_s3282
content: The Act is titled the "National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2016" and references modifications to the Dean John A. Knauuss Marine Policy Fellowship. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2016 amends Section 208(b) by changing "may" to "shall" and specifies placement priorities for legislative fellows in Congress. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2016 specifies placement priorities for legislative fellows in Congress, ensuring equitable distribution among political parties. The amendments apply to the first calendar year after enactment of the Act. The National Sea Grant College Program Amendments Act of 2016 specifies placement priorities for legislative fellows in Congress, ensuring equitable distribution among political parties. Congress encourages federal agencies to consider hiring former fellows for workforce positions. Modification of authority for Secretary of Commerce to accept donations for National Sea Grant College Program. The Secretary of Commerce can now accept donations of money and voluntary services for the National Sea Grant College Program. Priorities for the donations will be set by the Under Secretary of Commerce for Oceans and Atmosphere, including the potential expansion of the Dean John A. Knauss Marine Policy Fellowship. A report on the donations must be submitted within 180 days. The Director of the National Sea Grant College Program, in consultation with advisory boards, must develop recommendations for donations use and submit a report to Congress within 180 days. This section does not limit other funding available for marine policy fellowships. Funds may be allocated under specific sections of the Act (33 U.S.C. 1123(c)(4)(F) or 1131) for designated purposes. SEC. 5 repeals a reporting requirement on ocean and coastal research activities. SEC. 6 reduces the frequency of reports by the National Sea Grant Advisory Board. SEC. 7 modifies elements of the National Sea Grant College Program. SEC. 7 amends Section 204(b) of the National Sea Grant College Program to include additional purposes for financial assistance. SEC. 8 establishes direct hire authority and the Dean John A. Knauss Marine Policy Fellowship. During fiscal year 2016 and beyond, Federal agencies can appoint qualified candidates directly to positions without following certain provisions of the U.S. Code. This includes former recipients of the Dean John A. Knauss Marine Policy Fellowship who have relevant education and experience. Direct hire authority can be exercised for qualified candidates who have completed the fellowship within the executive or legislative branch of the U.S. Government, within 2 years of finishing the program. SEC. 9. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS FOR NATIONAL SEA GRANT COLLEGE PROGRAM. In General, Section 212(a) is amended to authorize appropriations to the Secretary for fiscal years 2016 through 2021. This includes specific amounts for each year and additional funding for priority activities through competitive grants. The Secretary is authorized appropriations for fiscal years 2016 through 2021 for competitive grants for university research on various topics including aquatic nonnative species, oyster diseases, harmful algal blooms, coastal resilience, working waterfronts, and sustainable aquaculture techniques. Aquaculture techniques and technologies are supported through fishery extension activities conducted by sea grant colleges or institutes. There are limitations on the amount that can be used for administration of programs under this title. The Director has the authority to address critical staffing requirements under subchapter VI of chapter 33 of title 5, United States Code. Any costs incurred for this purpose are not considered as part of the administration costs for programs under this title in a fiscal year. Section 204(d)(3) is amended regarding the allocation of funding. Section 204(d)(3) is amended to include sea grant programs and projects in funding allocation. Section 212 is amended by repealing subsection (c). Section 204(d)(3) is amended to include sea grant programs and projects in funding allocation. Subsection (c) is repealed, and subsections (d) and (e) are redesignated as subsections (c) and (d), respectively. SEC. 10. TECHNICAL CORRECTIONS. The National Sea Grant College Program Act is amended to adjust certain clauses and sentences. Passed the Senate on July 14, 2016.
